title: Using the Inverse Power Rule to Expand
text: We can use the power rule as follows. We know that the exponent that $$\log_{b}\left(M^n\right)=n\log_{b}\left(M\right)$$. In this case, $$M=x$$ and $$n=4$$. So, $$4ln(x)=\ln(x^4)$$
speech: We can use the power rule as follows. We know that the exponent that  the log base b of, parentheses   m to the n-th,  is equal to n the log base b of   m . In this case,    m is equal to x  and  n, is equal to, 4 . So, , 4 l n of x is equal to the natural log of, parentheses x to the fourth
